sections.purpose: To provide continuous heating of reaction mixtures without loss of solvent.
sections.scope: Applicable to synthesis in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Assemble the round-bottom flask, condenser, and heating mantle.
Apply a thin layer of grease to the ground-glass joints.
Connect the water inlet (bottom) and outlet (top) to the condenser.
Turn ON the cooling water and ensure a steady flow.
Add reaction mixture and boiling chips to the flask.
Turn ON the heat and monitor the reflux rate (1-2 drops per second).
After the reaction is complete, turn OFF the heat and allow the flask to cool.
Turn OFF the cooling water and dismantle the assembly for cleaning.
precautions: Never heat a closed system; ensure the top of the condenser is open or fitted with a drying tube.
Ensure the water flow is consistent to prevent solvent vapors from escaping.
Secure all joints with Keck clips to prevent accidental disconnection.
Handle hot glassware with appropriate heat-resistant gloves.
Check for leaks in the water tubing before starting the reaction.
